Definition_EN: Separate legal entity created for a narrowly defined financial objective to isolate risk.
Example_from_article_EN: An SPV is a distinct legal entity created by a founding organization for a narrowly defined financial objective.
Notes_FR: Also seen as « véhicule à finalité spécifique ». Keep acronym SPV.

Definition_EN: Synonym for Special Purpose Vehicle.
Example_from_article_EN: Special Purpose Vehicle and Special Purpose Entity are synonymous.
Notes_FR: Synonyme de SPV. Souvent « entité à finalité spécifique ».

Definition_EN: Structured to minimize the risk that a parent's bankruptcy affects the SPV and vice versa.
Example_from_article_EN: Structured to minimize the risk of parent's bankruptcy.
French_FR: à l’abri du risque de faillite
Notes_FR: Aussi « structure faiblement exposée à la faillite ».

Definition_EN: Separating assets and liabilities to isolate financial risk.
Example_from_article_EN: Off-balance-sheet legal structures to isolate financial risk by ring-fencing assets and liabilities.

Definition_EN: Not consolidated into the sponsor's balance sheet under certain accounting tests.
Example_from_article_EN: From their origins in the 1980s as off-balance-sheet legal structures.
Notes_FR: Sous IFRS/US GAAP, soumis à tests de consolidation.

Definition_EN: Entity whose income is taxed at investor level rather than at entity level.
Example_from_article_EN: SPVs are typically structured as pass-through entities.
Notes_FR: Traduction dépend du pays; « transparence fiscale ».

Definition_EN: Ownership held by an independent third party to enhance separateness.
Example_from_article_EN: Ownership can be held by an independent third party ("orphan" structure).

Definition_EN: Asset transfer designed to be bankruptcy‑resistant to the originator’s insolvency.
Example_from_article_EN: Assets are transferred via a "true sale".

Definition_EN: Priority of payments across fees, interest, principal, and residuals.
Example_from_article_EN: Define the cash flow waterfall, outlining the priority of payments.

Definition_EN: Contract term preventing creditors from initiating insolvency proceedings against the SPV.
Example_from_article_EN: Embedding non-petition language in all contracts.

Definition_EN: Contract term limiting creditor claims to the SPV’s assets.
Example_from_article_EN: Embedding limited-recourse language in all contracts.

Definition_EN: Director unaffiliated with the sponsor, often with veto on voluntary insolvency.
Example_from_article_EN: At least one independent director empowered to block any voluntary insolvency filing.
Notes_FR: Ou « gérant indépendant » selon forme juridique.

Definition_EN: The natural person(s) who ultimately owns or controls an entity.
Example_from_article_EN: Beneficial ownership updates.

Definition_EN: Know Your Customer checks to verify investor identity.
Example_from_article_EN: KYC/AML checks.
Notes_FR: Garder l’acronyme; ajouter expansion FR si utile.

Definition_EN: Anti-Money Laundering framework.
Example_from_article_EN: KYC/AML checks.
French_FR: LCB‑FT (lutte contre le blanchiment de capitaux et le financement du terrorisme)

Definition_EN: Investor meeting regulatory thresholds to participate in private offerings.
Example_from_article_EN: Offerings are often restricted to accredited investors.
Notes_FR: Terme US; en UE: investisseur professionnel.

Definition_EN: Fund that raises capital before specifying investments.
Example_from_article_EN: Faster and easier than raising a traditional blind-pool fund.

Definition_EN: Additional investment made in an existing portfolio company.
Example_from_article_EN: Exercise pro-rata rights to make follow-on investments.

Definition_EN: Investor right to maintain ownership percentage in future rounds.
Example_from_article_EN: Exercise pro-rata rights.

Definition_EN: Vehicle to hold a successful asset beyond the original fund’s term.
Example_from_article_EN: Used as continuation funds to hold onto a winning asset beyond a fund's lifecycle.

Definition_EN: Record of a company’s ownership and securities.
Example_from_article_EN: Adding a single line item to their capitalization table.

Definition_EN: Organizer who sources the deal and manages the SPV for a group of angels.
Example_from_article_EN: Syndicate leads.

Definition_EN: Net Asset Value.
Example_from_article_EN: Periodic updates on asset performance, NAV, and performance metrics.

Definition_EN: Internal Rate of Return.
Example_from_article_EN: Performance metrics (IRR, MOIC).

Definition_EN: Multiple on Invested Capital.
Example_from_article_EN: Performance metrics (IRR, MOIC).

Definition_EN: US entity type with limited liability and flexible pass-through taxation.
Example_from_article_EN: LLC is popular in the US.
Notes_FR: Ne pas traduire « LLC » dans les noms officiels.

Definition_EN: Partnership with general and limited partners; common for funds/SPVs.
Example_from_article_EN: Limited Partnership (LP).

Definition_EN: Company form with separate legal personality and shareholder liability limited to capital.
Example_from_article_EN: Can be established as a Corporation.

Definition_EN: Legal arrangement where a trustee holds assets for beneficiaries.
Example_from_article_EN: Trusts used for securitizations and orphan structures.
Notes_FR: « Fiducie » en droit civil; « trust » en common law.

Definition_EN: US entity with internally segregated series/portfolios.
Example_from_article_EN: Series / Segregated Structures (Series LLC).

Definition_EN: Offshore company with ring‑fenced portfolios.
Example_from_article_EN: Cayman Islands (SPC).

Definition_EN: UK corporate form with limited liability.
Example_from_article_EN: Private Limited Company (Ltd) is frequent.

Definition_EN: UK partnership tailored for funds; tax‑transparent.
Example_from_article_EN: PFLP is a common tax-transparent choice.
Notes_FR: Ne pas traduire; ajouter explication au besoin.

Definition_EN: UK nominee trust where trustee holds assets for beneficiaries.
Example_from_article_EN: Bare Trust is tax‑transparent.
Notes_FR: Terme de common law; garder anglais.

Definition_EN: French flexible corporate form with limited liability.
Example_from_article_EN: SAS is increasingly popular.

Definition_EN: French partnership, tax‑translucent; often used for real estate.
Example_from_article_EN: Société Civile (SC).

Definition_EN: French securitization vehicle; bankruptcy‑remote by statute.
Example_from_article_EN: Organisme de Titrisation (OT), fund form FCT.

Definition_EN: German limited liability company.
Example_from_article_EN: GmbH is common for a project-specific SPV.

Definition_EN: German limited partnership with a GmbH as general partner.
Example_from_article_EN: GmbH & Co. KG achieves limited liability with pass-through taxation.

Definition_EN: Luxembourg limited liability company used for SPVs/holdings.
Example_from_article_EN: SARL is the most common form used for investment SPVs.

Definition_EN: Luxembourg special limited partnership, tax‑transparent, no legal personality.
Example_from_article_EN: SCSp is highly flexible and fully tax-transparent.

Definition_EN: Luxembourg simple limited partnership; tax‑transparent.
Example_from_article_EN: SCS is a tax-transparent limited partnership.

Definition_EN: Luxembourg partnership limited by shares.
Example_from_article_EN: SCA combines corporate and partnership features.

Definition_EN: Spanish corporation often used for large securitizations.
Example_from_article_EN: S.A. is used for large or complex securitization transactions.

Definition_EN: Spanish limited liability company.
Example_from_article_EN: S.L. for smaller transactions.

Definition_EN: Transforming illiquid assets into tradable securities via an SPV.
Example_from_article_EN: Securitization relies on SPVs to transform illiquid assets into tradable securities.

Definition_EN: Securities backed by pools of assets such as loans or receivables.
Example_from_article_EN: The SPV then issues tradable, asset-backed securities to investors.

Definition_EN: Acquisition financed significantly with debt, often using an SPV.
Example_from_article_EN: Frequently used in LBOs to house acquisition debt.

Definition_EN: Special Purpose Acquisition Company used to take a firm public via merger.
Example_from_article_EN: SPACs raise capital through an IPO to acquire a private company.
Notes_FR: Peut se traduire par « société d’acquisition à vocation spécifique », usage rare.

Definition_EN: IPO structure where a C‑Corp holds partnership interests while public investors hold C‑Corp shares.
Example_from_article_EN: An Up‑C for IPOs.

Definition_EN: Collaboration between public and private sectors for large projects using an SPV.
Example_from_article_EN: SPVs are integral to public‑private partnerships (PPPs).

Definition_EN: Share of profits paid to the manager above the return of capital and hurdle.
Example_from_article_EN: Allows the organizer to earn carried interest.

Definition_EN: Periodic fee charged by the manager for administration.
Example_from_article_EN: May have no annual management fee.

Definition_EN: Misallocation of funds during distributions.
Example_from_article_EN: Waterfall & payment errors.

Definition_EN: EU Directive on Alternative Investment Fund Managers.
Example_from_article_EN: Stricter financial regulations like AIFMD.

Definition_EN: OECD action against Base Erosion and Profit Shifting.
Example_from_article_EN: BEPS initiatives.
French_FR: érosion de la base d’imposition et transfert de bénéfices (BEPS)

Definition_EN: US Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act.
Example_from_article_EN: FATCA/CRS reporting.

Definition_EN: OECD Common Reporting Standard for tax reporting.
Example_from_article_EN: FATCA/CRS reporting.

Definition_EN: US Securities and Exchange Commission.
Example_from_article_EN: Regulation is primarily overseen by the SEC.

Definition_EN: Service designated to receive legal documents on behalf of the entity.
Example_from_article_EN: Appoint a Registered Agent.
Notes_FR: Terme US; garder anglais entre parenthèses.

Definition_EN: Sufficient local activity to meet tax rules and avoid being a mere shell.
Example_from_article_EN: Ensure economic substance to comply with BEPS 2.0.

Definition_EN: Organization that creates the SPV to isolate risk.
Example_from_article_EN: Sponsor (or parent company) creates the SPV.

Definition_EN: Manager that directs the SPV or fund and may earn carry and fees.
Example_from_article_EN: Manager (GP or Syndicate Lead).

Definition_EN: Investor providing capital with limited liability and limited control.
Example_from_article_EN: Investors (or Limited Partners).

Definition_EN: Independent party holding assets or acting for investors.
Example_from_article_EN: Ownership can be held by an independent third party (trustee).

Definition_EN: Contractual obligations to maintain operational separation from sponsor.
Example_from_article_EN: Separateness covenants require separate bank accounts and books.

Definition_EN: Unstated guarantees by sponsor that undermine SPV independence.
Example_from_article_EN: Implicit sponsor support can undermine independence.

Definition_EN: Entity that persists without purpose, accruing costs and taxes.
Example_from_article_EN: Forgotten exit plan can create a "zombie" entity.

Definition_EN: Representing securities as digital tokens on a blockchain.
Example_from_article_EN: Representing SPV ownership interests as digital tokens.

Definition_EN: Decentralized Autonomous Organization.
Example_from_article_EN: DAOs as investment vehicles.

Definition_EN: Environmental, Social, and Governance criteria.
Example_from_article_EN: ESG and impact-driven SPVs.
French_FR: ESG (critères environnementaux, sociaux et de gouvernance)

Definition_EN: Bond to finance environmentally beneficial projects.
Example_from_article_EN: Creating Green Bonds by securitizing assets like solar leases.

Definition_EN: Outcome-based financing instrument for social programs.
Example_from_article_EN: Social Impact Bonds that fund social programs with returns tied to outcomes.

Definition_EN: US platform for venture and angel investing with standardized SPVs.
Example_from_article_EN: AngelList is a US-based platform optimized for venture and angel investing.

Definition_EN: End-to-end fund administration service supporting SPVs and funds.
Example_from_article_EN: Carta offers comprehensive fund administration.

Definition_EN: European platform specializing in cross-border angel investing and SPVs.
Example_from_article_EN: Roundtable makes it easy to launch and manage SPVs.

Definition_EN: Germany-based private markets platform for professional managers.
Example_from_article_EN: bunch is an all-in-one private markets platform.

Definition_EN: US platform focused on speed for launching SPVs.
Example_from_article_EN: Allocations markets itself on speed and simplicity.

Definition_EN: US low-cost automated SPV platform.
Example_from_article_EN: Sydecar is focused on a low-cost, automated solution.

Definition_EN: Institutional-grade platform now part of Apex Group.
Example_from_article_EN: Flow is an institutional-grade platform primarily focused on the U.S. market.

Definition_EN: UK platform serving angel syndicates in Europe.
Example_from_article_EN: Odin is a UK-based platform for angel syndicates.

Definition_EN: Platform focused on tokenized securities and secondary trading.
Example_from_article_EN: Securitize focuses on asset tokenization.
